briefdescription.para: Sets the texture search paths.

detaileddescription.para: Calling this method will clear and reload all textures, including the main rendering texture. Can cause a small delay/lag in rendering. Only use if texture paths were changed.

parameterdescription.para: A list of texture search paths.
The number of paths in the list.

briefdescription.para: Sets the beat sensitivity.

detaileddescription.para: The beat sensitivity to be used.

briefdescription.para: Returns the beat sensitivity.
Sets the minimum display time before a hard cut can happen.

detaileddescription.para: Hard cuts are beat-sensitive preset transitions, immediately changing from one preset to the next without a smooth blending period.
Set this to a higher value than preset duration to disable hard cuts.

parameterdescription.para: Minimum number of seconds the preset will be displayed before a hard cut.

briefdescription.para: Returns the minimum display time before a hard cut can happen.

simplesect.para: The minimum number of seconds the preset will be displayed before a hard cut.

briefdescription.para: Enables or disables hard cuts.

detaileddescription.para: Even if enabled, the hard cut duration must be set to a value lower than the preset duration to work properly.

parameterdescription.para: True to enable hard cuts, false to disable.

briefdescription.para: Returns whether hard cuts are enabled or not.

simplesect.para: True if hard cuts are enabled, false otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Sets the hard cut volume sensitivity.

detaileddescription.para: The beat detection volume difference that must be surpassed to trigger a hard cut.

parameterdescription.para: The volume threshold that triggers a hard cut if surpassed.

briefdescription.para: Returns the current hard cut sensitivity.
Sets the time in seconds for a soft transition between two presets.

detaileddescription.para: During a soft cut, both presets are rendered and slowly transitioned from one to the other.

parameterdescription.para: Time in seconds it takes to smoothly transition from one preset to another.

briefdescription.para: Returns the time in seconds for a soft transition between two presets.

simplesect.para: Time in seconds it takes to smoothly transition from one preset to another.

briefdescription.para: Sets the preset display duration before switching to the next using a soft cut.

detaileddescription.para: This can be considered as the maximum time a preset is displayed. If this time is reached, a smooth cut will be initiated. A hard cut, if any, will always happen before this time.

parameterdescription.para: The number of seconds a preset will be displayed before the next is shown.

briefdescription.para: Returns the preset display duration before switching to the next using a soft cut.

detaileddescription.para: This can be considered as the maximum time a preset is displayed. If this time is reached, a smooth cut will be initiated. A hard cut, if any, will always happen before this time.

simplesect.para: The currently set preset display duration in seconds.

briefdescription.para: Sets the per-pixel equation mesh size in units.

simplesect.para: This will currently remove any active presets and reload the default "idle" preset.

parameterdescription.para: The new width of the mesh.
The new height of the mesh.

briefdescription.para: Returns the per-pixel equation mesh size in units.
Sets the current/average frames per second.

detaileddescription.para: Applications running projectM should UpdateMeshSize this value regularly and set it to the calculated (and possibly averaged) FPS value the output rendered with. The value is passed on to presets, which may choose to use it for calculations. It is not used in any other way by the library.

parameterdescription.para: The current FPS value projectM is running with.

briefdescription.para: Returns the current/average frames per second.

detaileddescription.para: This value needs to be set by the application. If it wasn't set, a default value of 60 is used.

briefdescription.para: Enabled or disables aspect ratio correction in presets that support it.

detaileddescription.para: This sets a flag presets can use to aspect-correct rendered shapes, which otherwise would be distorted if the viewport isn't exactly square.

parameterdescription.para: True to enable aspect correction, false to disable it.

briefdescription.para: Returns whether aspect ratio correction is enabled or not.

simplesect.para: True if aspect ratio correction is enabled, false otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Sets the "easter egg" value.

detaileddescription.para: This doesn't enable any fancy feature, it only influences the randomized display time of presets. It's passed as the "sigma" value of the gaussian random number generator used to determine the maximum display time, effectively multiplying the generated number of seconds by this amount.
See function sampledPresetDuration() of the TimeKeeper class on how it is used.

briefdescription.para: Returns the current "easter egg" value.
Locks or unlocks the current preset.

detaileddescription.para: Locking effectively disables automatic preset transitions, both hard and soft cuts. Programmatic preset switches will still be executed.

parameterdescription.para: True to lock the current preset, false to enable automatic transitions.

briefdescription.para: Returns whether the current preset is locked or not.

simplesect.para: True if the preset lock is enabled, false otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Sets the current viewport size in pixels.

detaileddescription.para: Calling this function will reset the OpenGL renderer.

briefdescription.para: Returns the current viewport size in pixels.

parameterdescription.para: Valid pointer to a size_t variable that will receive the window width value.
Valid pointer to a size_t variable that will receive the window height value.

briefdescription.para: Functions to set and retrieve all sorts of projectM parameters and setting.
